title: Mercenary card

***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

|   |                                                          |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | The card depicts bloodied hands accepting a bag of gold. |

Drawing the **Mercenary card** will immediately generate a [durably summoned](/Durably_summoned "Durably summoned") mercenary which will offer you its services for a fee. The fee is roughly equal to the monster's [XP](/XP "XP") value, plus or minus 15 percent. A hired mercenary will be friendly, but if the player cannot or chooses not to purchase the ally, it will be hostile.

As a durably summoned monster, a mercenary gives no experience, cannot be abjured, never times out, and will not leave a corpse or any equipment behind upon death. However, they increase in strength as they deal the killing blow against enemies, and can grow into a more powerful creature after it gains enough experience. This is the list of possible mercenaries in ascending order of power:

- K [![Big kobold.png](/images/b/bb/Big_kobold.png)](/File:Big_kobold.png) **[Big kobold](/Big_kobold "Big kobold")**
- m [![Merfolk.png](/images/8/88/Merfolk.png)](/File:Merfolk.png) **[Merfolk](/Merfolk_\(monster\) "Merfolk (monster)")** -> grows into [![Merfolk impaler.png](/images/6/60/Merfolk_impaler.png)](/File:Merfolk_impaler.png) **[Merfolk impaler](/Merfolk_impaler "Merfolk impaler")**
- N [![Naga.png](/images/3/35/Naga.png)](/File:Naga.png) **[Naga](/Naga_\(monster\) "Naga (monster)")** -> grows into either [![Naga warrior.png](/images/d/d5/Naga_warrior.png)](/File:Naga_warrior.png) **[Naga warrior](/Naga_warrior "Naga warrior")** or [![Naga mage.png](/images/2/23/Naga_mage.png)](/File:Naga_mage.png) **[Naga mage](/Naga_mage "Naga mage")** and then into [![Greater naga.png](/images/b/bf/Greater_naga.png)](/File:Greater_naga.png) **[Greater naga](/Greater_naga "Greater naga")**
- H [![Tengu.png](/images/3/37/Tengu.png)](/File:Tengu.png) **[Tengu](/Tengu_\(monster\) "Tengu (monster)")** -> grows into either a [![Tengu conjurer.png](/images/a/ac/Tengu_conjurer.png)](/File:Tengu_conjurer.png) **[Tengu conjurer](/Tengu_conjurer "Tengu conjurer")** or [![Tengu warrior.png](/images/2/2e/Tengu_warrior.png)](/File:Tengu_warrior.png) **[Tengu warrior](/Tengu_warrior "Tengu warrior")** and then into [![Tengu reaver.png](/images/2/24/Tengu_reaver.png)](/File:Tengu_reaver.png) **[Tengu reaver](/Tengu_reaver "Tengu reaver")**
- e [![Deep elf conjurer.png](/images/e/ea/Deep_elf_conjurer.png)](/File:Deep_elf_conjurer.png) **[Deep elf conjurer](/Deep_elf_conjurer "Deep elf conjurer")** -> grows into [![Deep elf annihilator.png](/images/5/5f/Deep_elf_annihilator.png)](/File:Deep_elf_annihilator.png) **[Deep elf annihilator](/Deep_elf_annihilator "Deep elf annihilator")**
- o [![Orc knight.png](/images/1/16/Orc_knight.png)](/File:Orc_knight.png) **[Orc knight](/Orc_knight "Orc knight")** -> grows into [![Orc warlord.png](/images/7/76/Orc_warlord.png)](/File:Orc_warlord.png) **[Orc warlord](/Orc_warlord "Orc warlord")**
- 6 [![Demonspawn.png](/images/7/75/Demonspawn.png)](/File:Demonspawn.png) A random base **[demonspawn](/List_of_demonspawn "List of demonspawn")**
- O [![Ogre mage.png](/images/1/19/Ogre_mage.png)](/File:Ogre_mage.png) **[Ogre mage](/Ogre_mage "Ogre mage")**
- H [![Minotaur (monster).png](/images/5/5c/Minotaur_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Minotaur_\(monster\).png) **[Minotaur](/Minotaur_\(monster\) "Minotaur (monster)")**
- d [![Draconian (monster).png](/images/4/4f/Draconian_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Draconian_\(monster\).png) **[Draconian](/Draconian_\(monster\) "Draconian (monster)")** -> grows into a random coloured **[Draconian](/List_of_draconians "List of draconians")**
- e [![Deep elf blademaster.png](/images/9/9b/Deep_elf_blademaster.png)](/File:Deep_elf_blademaster.png) **[Deep elf blademaster](/Deep_elf_blademaster "Deep elf blademaster")**

High card power increases the chances of getting a stronger mercenary.

This card could be found in the following decks over the past versions, before its removal in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"):

## Tips & Tricks

- You can match your speed to your slowest ally by pressing **CTRL + e**. This is helpful for having slower mercenaries keep up with you, such as nagas.

## History

This card became unavailable in the simplification of decks in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").

Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), the list of possible mercenaries, in ascending order of power, was as follows:

- Big kobold
- Merfolk
- Naga
- Tengu
- Orc knight
- Centaur warrior
- Spriggan rider
- Ogre mage
- Minotaur
- Random base draconian
- Deep elf blademaster

The Mercenary card was added in [0.11](/0.11 "0.11")

Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
The card depicts bloodied hands accepting a bag of gold.

Drawing the Mercenary card will immediately generate a durably summoned mercenary which will offer you its services for a fee. The fee is roughly equal to the monster's XP value, plus or minus 15 percent. A hired mercenary will be friendly, but if the player cannot or chooses not to purchase the ally, it will be hostile.

As a durably summoned monster, a mercenary gives no experience, cannot be abjured, never times out, and will not leave a corpse or any equipment behind upon death. However, they increase in strength as they deal the killing blow against enemies, and can grow into a more powerful creature after it gains enough experience. This is the list of possible mercenaries in ascending order of power:

  • K Big kobold
  • m Merfolk -> grows into Merfolk impaler
  • N Naga -> grows into either Naga warrior or Naga mage and then into Greater naga
  • H Tengu -> grows into either a Tengu conjurer or Tengu warrior and then into Tengu reaver
  • e Deep elf conjurer -> grows into Deep elf annihilator
  • o Orc knight -> grows into Orc warlord
  • 6 A random base demonspawn
  • O Ogre mage
  • H Minotaur
  • d Draconian -> grows into a random coloured Draconian
  • e Deep elf blademaster

High card power increases the chances of getting a stronger mercenary.
